meanings.definition: To recover or regain possession of something by legal means.
meanings.sent1: She had to replevy her stolen bike from the thief.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer helped the client replevy the documents from the opposing party.
meanings.sent3: The detective decided to replevy the missing evidence in a clever way.
meanings.sent4: After a long legal battle, she finally managed to replevy her family heirloom.
meanings.sent5: The determined farmer replevied his livestock from the dishonest trader.

meanings.definition: The act of recovering or regaining possession of something by legal means.
meanings.sent1: The replevy of the stolen goods was a relief to the victim.
meanings.sent2: The court granted a replevy of the disputed property to the rightful owner.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected replevy of the lost treasure brought joy to the archaeologists.
meanings.sent4: The replevy of the valuable painting was a turning point in the art theft case.
